title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 151-3.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 151-3.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

In this Part: (a) Credit means credit in workers' compensation insurance premium provided to an insured employer that implements an approved WSLPIP. (b) Industrial Code Rule 60 means the rule promulgated by the Commissioner of Labor as 12 NYCRR
60. (c) Workplace Safety and Loss Prevention Incentive Program or WSLPIP means, pursuant to 12 NYCRR
60, a qualifying: (1)
safety incentive program; (2)
drug and alcohol prevention program; or
(3)
return to work program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
151-3.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
